column3: As in nature, as in art, so in grace; it is rough treatment that gives souls, as well as stones, their luster.
Art, as far as it is able, follows nature, as a pupil imitates his master; thus your art must be, as it were, God's grandchild.
Art can never exist without naked beauty displayed.
The art of the cuisine, when fully mastered, is the one human capability of which only good things can be said.
Art is a way to express yourself and through that you can escape a bad situation.
Art never seems to make me peaceful or pure.
Life is an illusion. I am held together in the nothingness by art.

Part of what I do and what I want to do is I want to bring art into the everyday life. If you can take ordinary just walking in the street and you're confronted by something, that might change your day - it might inspire you.
I'm into fashion because it contains the mood of the day, of the moment - like music, literature, and art.
Almost everything looks the same at art fairs - very hygienic, very white, lots of right angles.
Only in men's imagination does every truth find an effective and undeniable existence. Imagination, not invention, is the supreme master of art as of life.

There are worlds of experience beyond the world of the aggressive man, beyond history, and beyond science. The moods and qualities of nature and the revelations of great art are equally difficult to define; we can grasp them only in the depths of our perceptive spirit.
Everyone discusses my art and pretends to understand, as if it were necessary to understand, when it is simply necessary to love.
They say Princes learn no art truly, but the art of horsemanship. The reason is, the brave beast is no flatterer. He will throw a prince as soon as his groom.
Rhetoric is the art of ruling the minds of men.

People were more interested in the phenomena than the art itself. This, combined with the growing interest in collecting art as an investment and the resultant boom in the art market, made it a difficult time for a young artist to remain sincere without becoming cynical.
I think it's pretentious to create art just for the sake of stroking the artists ego.
I realize that every picture isn't a work of art.
Glory is a heavy burden, a murdering poison, and to bear it is an art. And to have that art is rare.
The most seductive thing about art is the personality of the artist himself.
There is no must in art because art is free.
I like to change. A new lamp, a piece of art, can transform a room.
I search for surprise in my architecture. A work of art should cause the emotion of newness.

We can learn the art of fierce compassion - redefining strength, deconstructing isolation and renewing a sense of community, practicing letting go of rigid us-vs.-them thinking - while cultivating power and clarity in response to difficult situations.
Performance art is going to be the future. Plays on Broadway are so restricted. But performance art is like haikus, just one line thing. And it's more casual but more interesting.

You've got to invest in the world, you've got to read, you've got to go to art galleries, you've got to find out the names of plants. You've got to start to love the world and know about the whole genius of the human race. We're amazing people.
